data.TITLE: Introduction
data.CONTENT:
This artifact was assembled from style-agnostic components.

All components use data-* attributes instead of style classes, making them completely reusable across different visual designs.

data.TITLE: What is Component Composition?
data.CONTENT:
Component composition is the practice of building complex UIs from small, reusable pieces that can be combined in different ways.

Key benefits:

  • Reusability across projects
  • Separation of structure and style
  • Easy to maintain and update
  • Swap styles without changing code

data.TITLE: The Three-Layer Model
data.CONTENT:
1. Structure - Semantic HTML with data attributes
  2. Style - CSS that targets data attributes
  3. Behavior - Optional JavaScript enhancements

This separation means you can:

  • Extract components from existing work
  • Reuse components in new projects
  • Change the look without touching structure
  • Add interactivity progressively

data.TITLE: Information-Only Storage
data.CONTENT:
Components store only information, no styling. This JSON file contains:

  • Structure (component types)
  • Content (text and HTML)
  • Configuration (state, ids)
  • Zero style information

The styling is applied separately when assembled!
